    • Method Detail

      • plot

        public java.io.File plot​(ExportGraph... graphs)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Plots the given graphs and adds the result to the document. This method blocks until all commands exported by the graphs have completed and the image generated by AptPlot is included in the document. If any critical plotting failure has occurred in a previous call to a plot method, this method returns immediately.
        Parameters:
        graphs - the graphs to plot
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getAptBatchIntf

        public AptBatchIntf getAptBatchIntf()
        Returns the AptBatchIntf used to send commands to AptPlot (in batch mode). This method lazily instantiates the AptPlot process and holds a reference to the process until such time that closeAptBatch is called. If AptPlot cannot be launched for whatever reason, this method returns null after printing an error message.
        Returns:
        the AptBatchIntf representing a running AptPlot process or null

      • closeAptBatch

        public void closeAptBatch()
        Closes a running AptPlot process if one is available. If AptPlot isn't running, this method does nothing.

      • sendCommand

        public static void sendCommand​(AptBatchIntf aptBatch,
                               java.lang.Object... command)
        Sends a command to the given AptBatchIntf. This method concatenates the toString of each value in command as the command passed to AptPlot. If either parameter is null or command has zero length, the method returns immediately.
        Parameters:
        aptBatch - the interface to AptPlot in batch mode used to send the command
        command - the var-args list of command fragments

      • sanitize

        public static java.lang.String sanitize​(java.lang.String text)
        Sanitizes a string for use in an AptPlot string expression. This method safely accepts null.
        Parameters:
        text - the content to sanitize
        Returns:
        the sanitized value, which will never be null

      • unitsForAptPlot

        public static java.lang.String unitsForAptPlot​(CReal sample)
        Creates an AptPlot-typeset unit string for the given real. This method uses the real's parent-model current units to determine the unit string returned. Consequently, the sample must have a valid reference to its parent model. This method safely accepts null.
        Parameters:
        sample - a sample of the unit
        Returns:
        the typeset unit string, which will never be null (but may be empty)

      • isFailedPlot

        public boolean isFailedPlot()
        returns true if this GraphWriter has already failed to plot
